member.name: T:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog
member.summary: Represents a dialog that can be used to report progress to the user.

remarks.para: This class provides a wrapper for the native Windows IProgressDialog API.
The class requires Windows 2000, Windows Me, or newer versions of Windows.

member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.name: M:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.Show
member.summary: Displays the progress dialog as a modeless dialog.

remarks.para: This function will not block the parent window and will return immediately.

Although this function returns immediately, you cannot use the UI thread to do any processing. The dialog will not function correctly unless the UI thread continues to handle window messages, so that thread may not be blocked by some other activity. All processing related to the progress dialog must be done in the event handler.

member.exception: The animation specified in the property could not be loaded.

member.name: M:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.Show(System.Object)
member.summary: Displays the progress dialog as a modeless dialog.
member.param: A parameter for use by the background operation to be executed in the event handler.

remarks.para: This function will not block the parent window and return immediately.

Although this function returns immediately, you cannot use the UI thread to do any processing. The dialog will not function correctly unless the UI thread continues to handle window messages, so that thread may not be blocked by some other activity. All processing related to the progress dialog must be done in the event handler.

member.exception: The animation specified in the property could not be loaded.

member.name: M:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.ShowDialog
member.summary: Displays the progress dialog as a modal dialog.

remarks.para: The ShowDialog function for most .Net dialogs will not return until the dialog is closed. However, the function for the class will return immediately. The parent window will be disabled as with all modal dialogs.

Although this function returns immediately, you cannot use the UI thread to do any processing. The dialog will not function correctly unless the UI thread continues to handle window messages, so that thread may not be blocked by some other activity. All processing related to the progress dialog must be done in the event handler.
The progress dialog's window will appear in the taskbar. This behaviour is also contrary to most .Net dialogs, but is part of the underlying native progress dialog API so cannot be avoided.
When possible, it is recommended that you use a modeless dialog using the function.

member.exception: The animation specified in the property could not be loaded.

member.name: M:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.ShowDialog(System.Windows.Window)
member.summary: Displays the progress dialog as a modal dialog.
member.param: The window that owns the dialog.

remarks.para: The ShowDialog function for most .Net dialogs will not return until the dialog is closed. However, the function for the class will return immediately. The parent window will be disabled as with all modal dialogs.

Although this function returns immediately, you cannot use the UI thread to do any processing. The dialog will not function correctly unless the UI thread continues to handle window messages, so that thread may not be blocked by some other activity. All processing related to the progress dialog must be done in the event handler.
The progress dialog's window will appear in the taskbar. This behaviour is also contrary to most .Net dialogs, but is part of the underlying native progress dialog API so cannot be avoided.
When possible, it is recommended that you use a modeless dialog using the function.

member.exception: The animation specified in the property could not be loaded, or the operation is already running.

member.summary: Displays the progress dialog as a modal dialog.
member.param: The window that owns the dialog.
A parameter for use by the background operation to be executed in the event handler.

remarks.para: The ShowDialog function for most .Net dialogs will not return until the dialog is closed. However, the function for the class will return immediately. The parent window will be disabled as with all modal dialogs.

Although this function returns immediately, you cannot use the UI thread to do any processing. The dialog will not function correctly unless the UI thread continues to handle window messages, so that thread may not be blocked by some other activity. All processing related to the progress dialog must be done in the event handler.
The progress dialog's window will appear in the taskbar. This behaviour is also contrary to most .Net dialogs, but is part of the underlying native progress dialog API so cannot be avoided.
When possible, it is recommended that you use a modeless dialog using the function.

member.exception: The animation specified in the property could not be loaded, or the operation is already running.

member.name: P:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.WindowTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets the text in the progress dialog's title bar.
member.value: The text in the progress dialog's title bar. The default value is an empty string.

remarks.para: This property must be set before or is called. Changing property has no effect while the dialog is being displayed.

member.name: P:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets a short description of the operation being carried out.
member.value: A short description of the operation being carried. The default value is an empty string.

remarks.para: This is the primary message to the user.

This property can be changed while the dialog is running, but may only be changed from the thread which created the progress dialog. The recommended method to change this value while the dialog is running is to use the method.

member.name: P:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.UseCompactPathsForText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether path strings in the property should be compacted if they are too large to fit on one line.
member.value: to compact path strings if they are too large to fit on one line; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.note: This property requires Windows Vista or later. On older versions of Windows, it has no effect.
remarks.para: This property can be changed while the dialog is running, but may only be changed from the thread which created the progress dialog.

member.name: P:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets additional details about the operation being carried out.
member.value: Additional details about the operation being carried out. The default value is an empty string.
member.remarks: This text is used to provide additional details beyond the property.

remarks.para: This property can be changed while the dialog is running, but may only be changed from the thread which created the progress dialog. The recommended method to change this value while the dialog is running is to use the method.

member.name: P:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.UseCompactPathsForDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether path strings in the property should be compacted if they are too large to fit on one line.
member.value: to compact path strings if they are too large to fit on one line; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.note: This property requires Windows Vista or later. On older versions of Windows, it has no effect.
remarks.para: This property can be changed while the dialog is running, but may only be changed from the thread which created the progress dialog.

member.name: P:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.CancellationText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that will be shown after the Cancel button is pressed.
member.value: The text that will be shown after the Cancel button is pressed.

remarks.para: This property must be set before or is called. Changing property has no effect while the dialog is being displayed.

member.name: P:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.ShowTimeRemaining
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether an estimate of the remaining time will be shown.
member.value: if an estimate of remaining time will be shown; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.para: This property must be set before or is called. Changing property has no effect while the dialog is being displayed.

member.name: P:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.ShowCancelButton
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the dialog has a cancel button.
member.value: if the dialog has a cancel button; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.note: This property requires Windows Vista or later; on older versions of Windows, the cancel button will always be displayed.
remarks.para: The event handler for the event must periodically check the value of the property to see if the operation has been cancelled if this property is .
Setting this property to is not recommended unless absolutely necessary.

member.name: P:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.MinimizeBox
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the progress dialog has a minimize button.
member.value: if the dialog has a minimize button; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.note: This property has no effect on modal dialogs (which do not have a minimize button). It only applies to modeless dialogs shown by using the method.
remarks.para: This property must be set before is called. Changing property has no effect while the dialog is being displayed.

member.name: P:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.CancellationPending
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the user has requested cancellation of the operation.
member.value: if the user has cancelled the progress dialog; otherwise, . The default is .
member.remarks: The event handler for the event must periodically check this property and abort the operation if it returns .

member.name: P:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.Animation
member.summary: Gets or sets the animation to show on the progress dialog.
member.value: An instance of which specifies the animation to show, or to show no animation. The default value is .

remarks.para: This property has no effect on Windows Vista or later. On Windows XP, this property will default to a flying papers animation.
This property must be set before or is called. Changing property has no effect while the dialog is being displayed.

member.name: P:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.ProgressBarStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a regular or marquee style progress bar should be used.
member.value: One of the values of . The default value is .

remarks.note: Operating systems older than Windows Vista do not support marquee progress bars on the progress dialog. On those operating systems, the progress bar will be hidden completely if this property is .
remarks.para: When this property is set to , use the method to set the value of the progress bar. When this property is set to you can still use the method to update the text of the dialog, but the percentage will be ignored.
This property must be set before or is called. Changing property has no effect while the dialog is being displayed.

member.name: P:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.ProgressDialog.IsBusy
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the is running an asynchronous operation.
member.value: if the is running an asynchronous operation; otherwise, .

member.name: T:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.DownlevelTextMode
member.summary: An enumeration that displays how the text in the and properties is displayed on a credential dialog in Windows XP.

remarks.para: Windows XP does not support the distinct visual style of the main instruction, so there is no visual difference between the text of the and properties. Depending on the scenario, you may wish to hide either the main instruction or the content text.

member.name: F:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.DownlevelTextMode.MainInstructionAndContent
member.summary: The text of the and properties is concatenated together, separated by an empty line.

member.name: F:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.DownlevelTextMode.MainInstructionOnly
member.summary: Only the text of the property is shown.

member.name: F:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.DownlevelTextMode.ContentOnly
member.summary: Only the text of the property is shown.

member.name: T:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.VistaOpenFileDialog
member.summary: Prompts the user to open a file.

remarks.para: Windows Vista provides a new style of common file dialog, with several new features (both from the user's and the programmers perspective).

This class will use the Vista-style file dialogs if possible, and automatically fall back to the old-style dialog on versions of Windows older than Vista. This class is aimed at applications that target both Windows Vista and older versions of Windows, and therefore does not provide any of the new APIs provided by Vista's file dialogs.
This class precisely duplicates the public interface of so you can just replace any instances of with the without any further changes to your code.

member.name: T:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.VistaFileDialog
member.summary: Displays a dialog box from which the user can select a file.

remarks.para: Windows Vista provides a new style of common file dialog, with several new features (both from the user's and the programmers perspective).

This class and derived classes will use the Vista-style file dialogs if possible, and automatically fall back to the old-style dialog on versions of Windows older than Vista. This class is aimed at applications that target both Windows Vista and older versions of Windows, and therefore does not provide any of the new APIs provided by Vista's file dialogs.
This class precisely duplicates the public interface of so you can just replace any instances of with the without any further changes to your code.

member.value: if Vista-style common file dialgs are supported; otherwise, .

remarks.para: Returns on Windows Vista or newer operating systems.
If this property returns , the class (and its derived classes) will fall back to the regular file dialog.

member.name: T:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.VistaFolderBrowserDialog
member.summary: Prompts the user to select a folder.
member.remarks: This class will use the Vista style Select Folder dialog if possible, or the regular FolderBrowserDialog if it is not. Note that the Vista style dialog is very different, so using this class without testing in both Vista and older Windows versions is not recommended.

member.value: if the New Folder button is shown in the dialog box; otherwise, . The default is .

member.name: P:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.VistaFolderBrowserDialog.UseDescriptionForTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to use the value of the property as the dialog title for Vista style dialogs. This property has no effect on old style dialogs.
member.value: to indicate that the value of the property is used as dialog title; to indicate the value is added as additional text to the dialog. The default is .

member.name: T:Ookii.Dialogs.Wpf.VistaSaveFileDialog
member.summary: Prompts the user to select a location for saving a file.
member.remarks: This class will use the Vista style save file dialog if possible, and automatically fall back to the old-style dialog on versions of Windows older than Vista.

remarks.para: Windows Vista provides a new style of common file dialog, with several new features (both from the user's and the programmers perspective).

This class will use the Vista-style file dialogs if possible, and automatically fall back to the old-style dialog on versions of Windows older than Vista. This class is aimed at applications that target both Windows Vista and older versions of Windows, and therefore does not provide any of the new APIs provided by Vista's file dialogs.
This class precisely duplicates the public interface of so you can just replace any instances of with the without any further changes to your code.
